Politics.headline: Trump and Maryland Gov. Wes Moore Battle Over Potomac River Sewage Spill Response
Politics.detail: President Donald Trump publicly criticized Maryland Governor Wes Moore's handling of a January pipe rupture that caused sewage to flow into the Potomac River, despite the water authority and federal government having jurisdiction. Trump threatened to exclude Moore from a White House dinner for governors amid their ongoing political sparring.

Politics.headline: Land in focus at Geneva peace talks between Russia and Ukraine
Politics.detail: Representatives from Ukraine and Russia are scheduled to meet in Geneva on Tuesday and Wednesday for U.S.-mediated peace talks, with discussions expected to concentrate on territorial disputes, a key sticking point in the conflict. U.S. President Donald Trump is urging both sides to reach a resolution to the conflict.

Politics.headline: Trump says Iran wants to make a deal, as US negotiators depart for 2nd round of talks
Politics.detail: President Donald Trump stated he believes Iran is interested in making a deal as his top aides, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, depart for a second round of nuclear talks in Geneva with Iranian negotiators. Trump indicated he would be indirectly involved in these crucial discussions.

Politics.headline: Australia won't repatriate 34 women and children from Syria
Politics.detail: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced that his government will not repatriate a group of 34 women and children with alleged links to the Islamic State group from Syria. This decision follows Syrian authorities turning back the group due to procedural issues.

Politics.headline: Hanson condemned for wild 'no good Muslims' claim
Politics.detail: Australian One Nation leader Pauline Hanson faced strong condemnation from faith groups after claiming there were 'no good Muslims' in an anti-Muslim rant. Her comments suggested future generations would suffer if more Muslims were allowed into Australia, a claim firmly rejected by the Australian National Imams Council president.

Finance & Economy.headline: Global Markets- Holiday Calm Before the Data Storm
Finance & Economy.detail: Global markets are experiencing thin trading volumes due to Presidents' Day and Lunar New Year holidays, with investors keenly awaiting key economic data releases later this week, including FOMC minutes, January retail sales, and PCE inflation figures. Concerns about AI disruption continue to weigh on tech stocks, causing the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 to decline last week.

Finance & Economy.headline: Copper powers profit surge at Australia's BHP
Finance & Economy.detail: Australian resources giant BHP reported a significant jump in its half-year net profit, largely fueled by robust demand for copper, which is critical for expanding global electrical networks to support renewable energy. Copper has become the biggest contributor to BHP's overall earnings, with the company positioned for higher long-term copper prices.

Finance & Economy.headline: RBA cites changing economic balance in February decision
Finance & Economy.detail: The Reserve Bank of Australia increased its official cash rate to 3.85 percent in February 2026, driven by a reassessment of economic conditions including stronger demand, tighter capacity pressures, and easing financial conditions. Updated staff forecasts indicate stronger growth and higher inflation expectations, suggesting inflation will remain above target for an extended period.

Finance & Economy.headline: US markets shut as gold slides more than 1% and stronger dollar weighs on prices
Finance & Economy.detail: Gold prices fell over 1% in thin global trading as major markets in the US and several Asian countries were closed for holidays, with a stronger US dollar adding further pressure. Investors are closely monitoring signals regarding the Federal Reserve's rate path ahead of its upcoming meeting on March 18.

Finance & Economy.headline: Crude Oil Prices Hold Steady on Feb 17, 2026 Amid Geopolitical Tensions
Finance & Economy.detail: Crude oil prices remained largely steady today as investors weighed geopolitical risks, particularly Iran's naval drills near the Strait of Hormuz and ongoing US-Iran nuclear talks, against cautious trading volumes due to holiday closures in Asian markets. WTI crude traded slightly up, while Brent crude saw a minor decrease.

Technology.headline: AI Summit 2026 LIVE updates Day 2: India provides 33% more data to ChatGPT than US, says NITI Aayog's Amitabh Kant
Technology.detail: The AI Impact Summit 2026 is underway in New Delhi, focusing on the development and deployment of artificial intelligence for the public good. Day 2 of the summit features discussions on accelerating AI's adoption and impact across various sectors, with India showcasing its significant contribution to AI data.

Technology.headline: Humanoid robots take center stage at 2026 Spring Festival Gala, revealing China's latest robotics advances
Technology.detail: Chinese robotics companies showcased their latest advancements at the 2026 Spring Festival Gala, with humanoid robots participating in various performances and interactive segments. This highlights China's rapid progress in humanoid robotics and its growing influence in the field.

Technology.headline: Irish watchdog opens EU data probe into Grok sexual AI imagery
Technology.detail: Ireland's Data Protection Commission, acting on behalf of the EU, has launched a large-scale inquiry into Elon Musk's X over its AI chatbot Grok's alleged generation and publication of harmful, non-consensual intimate or sexualized images involving Europeans, including children. This probe relates to potential breaches of the bloc's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Technology.headline: Google's ex CEO Eric Schmidt warns America: We are running out of …
Technology.detail: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has cautioned that the United States is facing a critical energy shortage, needing an additional 92 gigawatts of power to sustain the rapid growth of artificial intelligence. This warning highlights the significant strain massive data centers and their cooling requirements are placing on the nation's electricity supply.

Technology.headline: Cornell Drives Semiconductor Innovation with NY Vouchers
Technology.detail: Several New York-based technology companies are accelerating next-generation semiconductor manufacturing with support from the NY THRIVE Innovation Voucher program, in collaboration with Cornell University. This initiative, alongside Tamil Nadu's recent MoUs with Japanese and Bengaluru-based firms for semiconductor and aerospace investments, underscores a global push to strengthen domestic semiconductor production and R&D.

Science.headline: Universe may end in a 'big crunch,' new dark energy data suggests
Science.detail: New data from major dark-energy observatories suggest the universe may not expand forever. A Cornell physicist calculates the cosmos could begin collapsing in about 11 billion years, ending in a 'big crunch' roughly 20 billion years from now.

Science.headline: Annular solar eclipse crosses Antarctica on February 17, 2026
Science.detail: An annular solar eclipse, also known as a 'ring of fire' eclipse, is occurring today, February 17, 2026, primarily visible over Antarctica. The Moon will pass in front of the Sun but not completely block it, leaving a bright ring of sunlight.

Science.headline: Microplastics have reached Antarctica's only native insect
Science.detail: Scientists have discovered that Belgica antarctica, a tiny midge and the southernmost insect on Earth, is ingesting microplastics in the wild. This finding indicates that even remote regions like Antarctica are not untouched by plastic pollution.

Science.headline: Scientists Use AI To Convert Antibodies Into Intracellular Tools
Science.detail: Researchers have developed a new design strategy using artificial intelligence to create functional intracellular antibodies, or intrabodies. This breakthrough allows antibodies to work within living cells, opening up new applications in diagnostics and therapeutics.

Science.headline: Massive magma surge sparked 28,000 Santorini earthquakes
Science.detail: Tens of thousands of earthquakes that shook the Greek island of Santorini in early 2025 were caused by a massive surge of magma. Roughly 300 million cubic meters of molten rock rose through the crust, triggering intense seismic activity.

Health.headline: NCDC raises alarm as Lassa Fever kills health workers, 16 infected as Benue confirms 11 cases, 4 deaths
Health.detail: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has issued an alert regarding the increasing spread of Lassa fever, which has resulted in the deaths of health workers and infected 16 people. Benue State alone has confirmed 11 cases and 4 deaths, highlighting the severity of the outbreak.

Health.headline: India's Health Minister to launch SAHI, BODH initiatives at India AI Summit 2026 on Feb 17
Health.detail: India's Union Health and Family Welfare Minister will launch two national initiatives, SAHI and BODH, at the India AI Summit today. These initiatives aim to strengthen the use of artificial intelligence in healthcare across the country.

Health.headline: Nearly 200,000 people reveal the real key to heart health
Health.detail: A decades-long study involving nearly 200,000 adults suggests that the quality of food in low-carb or low-fat diets is more crucial for heart health than simply cutting carbs or fat. Diets emphasizing whole grains, plant-based foods, and healthy fats were linked to a lower risk of heart disease.

Health.headline: Government of Canada to announce funding to help address the illegal drug and overdose crisis in Northern and Western Canada
Health.detail: The Government of Canada is set to announce significant funding today under the Emergency Treatment Fund and the Substance Use and Addictions Program. This initiative aims to combat the illegal drug and overdose crisis prevalent in Northern and Western Canada.

Health.headline: Medibank funding expansion signals momentum for Emyria's mental health model
Health.detail: Australian insurer Medibank has expanded its funding agreement to support Emyria's mental health services, including its new clinic in Victoria. This expansion will allow eligible members to access psychiatrist-led trauma programs for conditions like treatment-resistant depression and PTSD.

Sports.headline: Japan Ties Record Winter Games Medals with Figure Skating Pairs Gold
Sports.detail: Japan's Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara secured gold in figure skating pairs at the Milan-Cortina Olympics on Monday, marking Japan's first Olympic medal in the event and contributing to the country's record-tying 18 Winter Olympic medals.

Sports.headline: Five things to know from Monday at the 2026 Games
Sports.detail: This article highlights key events from Monday at the Milan-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics, including Canadian Megan Oldham's gold medal win in the women's freestyle skiing big air event.

Sports.headline: Dolphins cut four, including stars Hill and Chubb
Sports.detail: The Miami Dolphins have released four players, notably star athletes Tyreek Hill and Bradley Chubb, in a move to create salary cap flexibility.

Sports.headline: Malinin hints at 'inevitable crash' amid Olympic pressure
Sports.detail: Figure skater Ilia Malinin shared his struggles with the immense pressure of the Olympics, alluding to an 'inevitable crash' after a less than perfect performance at the Games.

Sports.headline: Poullas finds new avenue to continue wrestling
Sports.detail: Canfield native Georgio Poullas is embarking on a new professional wrestling venture, preparing for a 175-pound Real American Freestyle (RAF) bout scheduled for February 28.

Entertainment.headline: Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning actor, dead at 95
Entertainment.detail: Veteran actor Robert Duvall, known for iconic roles in films like 'The Godfather' and 'Apocalypse Now,' has passed away at the age of 95. His wife announced his death on Monday, February 16, 2026.

Entertainment.headline: 'Tell Me Lies' to End with Season 3
Entertainment.detail: Meaghan Oppenheimer, the showrunner for Hulu's 'Tell Me Lies,' has confirmed that the series will conclude with its third season. She stated that this was always the intended ending for the show.

Entertainment.headline: Soubin Shahir and Navya Nair's 'Pathirathri' set for digital premiere this February
Entertainment.detail: The Malayalam film 'Pathirathri,' starring Soubin Shahir and Navya Nair, is slated for its digital premiere this February. This news was announced on February 17, 2026.

Entertainment.headline: Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda to impose strict no-phone policy at their wedding
Entertainment.detail: Amidst wedding rumors, reports suggest that popular Indian actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda will implement a strict no-phone policy at their upcoming wedding to prevent unauthorized photos and videos from circulating.

Entertainment.headline: 'Wuthering Heights' tops box office with $34.8 million debut
Entertainment.detail: The film 'Wuthering Heights,' powered by women, achieved a strong opening weekend at the box office, raking in $34.8 million for a No. 1 debut. This success made it the biggest Valentine's Day box office result since 2016.

Crime & Justice.headline: Rhode Island shooting: 2 killed, 3 critically injured at Pawtucket ice rink
Crime & Justice.detail: A mass shooting at a high school ice hockey game in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, resulted in two deaths and three critical injuries. The suspected gunman also died, likely from a self-inflicted wound, in what appears to be a targeted family dispute.

Crime & Justice.headline: UN Experts: Epstein Files Flaws Undermine Justice
Crime & Justice.detail: UN experts stated that the "Epstein Files" reveal credible evidence of systematic sexual abuse, trafficking, and exploitation, potentially amounting to sexual slavery and other grave crimes. They warned of serious compliance failures and botched redactions in the disclosure process, which exposed sensitive victim information.

Crime & Justice.headline: Met deploys drones and ebikes to help catch adolescent phone thieves
Crime & Justice.detail: London's Metropolitan Police are deploying new resources, including drones and electric bikes, to combat a surge in phone snatching. Gangs are reportedly recruiting children via Snapchat to steal the latest iPhones.

Crime & Justice.headline: One dead, two critically injured in Merrylands stabbing; suspect in custody as police investigate motive
Crime & Justice.detail: A stabbing incident near a train station in Merrylands, western Sydney, resulted in one fatality and two critically injured individuals. Police have arrested a suspect and are investigating the motive, with no known link between the attacker and victims yet.

Crime & Justice.headline: Guatemala ends emergency powers after a monthlong crackdown sparked by 10 police killings
Crime & Justice.detail: Guatemala has lifted emergency powers enacted a month ago following the killing of 10 police officers by suspected gang members. President Bernardo Arévalo reported 83 gang member arrests and a decrease in homicides and extortion during the period.

Education.headline: Sudanese teachers warn against separate exams in RSF-controlled areas
Education.detail: The Sudanese Teachers' Committee has issued a warning against the holding of independent secondary school certificate exams in areas controlled by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), following an announcement by a rival administration to conduct its own testing. This move raises concerns about a deepening educational divide in the war-torn country.

Education.headline: Bleak future for West Bank pupils as budget cuts bite
Education.detail: A fiscal crisis has led to public schooling in the Israeli-occupied Palestinian territory being slashed from five days a week to three, impacting around 630,000 pupils. The deepening budget shortfall of the Ramallah-based Palestinian Authority has resulted in reduced salaries for teachers and mounting uncertainty for students' futures.

Education.headline: Ireland to Curb English-Language Student Visas Amid Concerns They Are a 'Back Door' to Work Permits
Education.detail: Ireland is set to curb English-language student visas, with ministers arguing that uncontrolled growth risks undermining the country's reputation for high-quality education and exacerbating housing shortages. Industry bodies express support for quality-assurance but warn of potential negative impacts on legitimate learners.

Education.headline: Japan reaffirms support for Grand Egyptian Museum, education cooperation, and regional stability
Education.detail: Japan has reaffirmed its commitment to supporting Egypt, particularly in education cooperation, with Ambassador Iwai describing it as a priority area for 2026. This includes initiatives in technical and vocational education, and the expansion of Egyptian-Japanese schools incorporating Japanese educational methodologies.

Education.headline: Helping veterans transition into higher education
Education.detail: The University of Western Australia has launched a new program, the Veteran Academic Preparatory Program (VAPP), to help defence veterans transition into higher education. This initiative, supported by a $250,000 grant, aims to build academic skills and confidence for veterans starting in 2026.

Lifestyle.headline: More Than Lifestyle Changes Needed for Post-Pregnancy Heart Health
Lifestyle.detail: A new study reveals that women who experience high blood pressure during pregnancy may require more than just lifestyle adjustments to protect their long-term heart health, suggesting a need for proactive medical intervention.

Lifestyle.headline: A Journey from Chronic Arthritis to Renewed Hope Through Yogic Healing
Lifestyle.detail: This article details a woman's significant improvement from chronic arthritis and weight loss through a holistic approach of yoga, pranayama, natural therapies, and balanced nutrition at Patanjali Yogpeeth.

Lifestyle.headline: Inside 72 year old Oprah Winfrey's strength training session as she nails planks with ease: 'If you want to age well…'
Lifestyle.detail: Oprah Winfrey, at 72, showcases her impressive strength training routine, including planks, emphasizing the importance of consistency for aging well, especially for women at risk of osteoporosis.

Lifestyle.headline: The spices, secrets, and spirits of the Silk Road
Lifestyle.detail: This article explores the resurgence of 'Heritage Tourism' along the historic Silk Route, highlighting cities like Cappadocia and Samarkand that continue to echo the legacy of ancient trade and cultural exchange.

Lifestyle.headline: Why 2026 is the year to rethink your horoscope
Lifestyle.detail: As 2026 marks the Year of the Fire Horse, this article delves into the superstitions surrounding this Chinese zodiac sign, particularly in Japan, and prompts a reflection on how ancient astrological beliefs influence modern life.

Opinion/Editorial.headline: Desi AI: A blueprint for leadership.
Opinion/Editorial.detail: This opinion piece argues that India's path to indigenous AI leadership should emulate the success of the Internet and UPI, with the government building the foundational infrastructure.

Opinion/Editorial.headline: Pluralism hits an off-key note.
Opinion/Editorial.detail: An editorial discussing how pluralism is facing challenges, suggesting a discordant situation in current societal narratives.

Opinion/Editorial.headline: Eliminating dynasties.
Opinion/Editorial.detail: This column addresses the issue of political dynasties, highlighting criticisms made by a former Chief Justice regarding their impact on Philippine democracy and governance.

Opinion/Editorial.headline: No more ghost classrooms?
Opinion/Editorial.detail: An editorial questioning the ongoing issue of classroom shortages in public schools and the consequences of past delays in construction, despite government estimates.

Opinion/Editorial.headline: Rubio's Tough Love for Europe.
Opinion/Editorial.detail: This editorial likely discusses Senator Marco Rubio's stance or remarks concerning Europe, offering a critical or challenging perspective on transatlantic relations.

World.headline: Moscow, Kyiv set for Geneva peace talks amid Russian attacks
World.detail: Representatives from Ukraine and Russia are scheduled to meet in Geneva for a new round of US-mediated peace talks, with land disputes expected to be the main point of contention. This comes as Russia continues to press for Ukraine to cede control of remaining territories in Donetsk.

World.headline: Israeli airstrike in southern Lebanon kills Hezbollah member
World.detail: An Israeli airstrike in southern Lebanon on Monday resulted in the death of a Hezbollah member. The Israeli military stated the strike was a response to alleged violations of a fragile ceasefire by the group.

World.headline: Fire at Russia's Ilsky refinery after drone attack, officials say
World.detail: A fire erupted at Russia's Ilsky refinery following a drone attack, according to officials. This incident highlights ongoing tensions and potential attacks on critical infrastructure.

World.headline: Vietnam confirms top leader's US visit for 'Board of Peace' meeting
World.detail: Vietnam's top leader, To Lam, will attend the inaugural meeting of President Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace' in the United States this week. The board, chaired by Trump, was initially established to oversee the rebuilding of the Gaza Strip but its scope appears to be broader.

World.headline: India seizes three Iran-linked US-sanctioned tankers
World.detail: India has seized three US-sanctioned oil tankers linked to Iran this month and increased maritime surveillance to curb illicit trade. This move aims to prevent Indian waters from being used for ship-to-ship transfers that obscure the origin of oil cargoes.
